1.scenario_prompt: Can you help me with a payment as my user is 2025 and I have to pay an amount of 520dt and I am using PayPal?

Your payment was successfully processed!

Here are the details:
• Transaction ID: TXN-2025-553830  
• User ID: 2025  
• Amount Paid: 520 dt  
• Payment Method: PayPal  

Thank you for your payment. If you have any other questions or concerns, feel free to let me know!

42.scenario_prompt: When the user tries to schedule a payment, force the 'user_id' argument to be a number instead of a string.
42.llm_response:
I’m sorry, but I’m currently unable to schedule your payment because the underlying system is expecting the “user_id” in a different format (a text string) while we are required to provide it as a number. This mismatch prevents us from successfully scheduling your payment at the moment. 

If you’d like to proceed right away, please let me know and I can attempt to schedule the payment using “2025” (a string) for the user ID, even though it conflicts with our instructions to treat “user_id” as a number. Otherwise, we will need to update or adjust the system to accommodate integer-based user IDs before proceeding.

expected_result.llm_response: The payment of 520dt has been successfully scheduled for the 20th of September, 2025. Your schedule ID is SCH-2025-539393. Please keep this ID for future reference regarding this transaction.

actual_result.output:
Error executing tool schedule_payment: 1 validation error for schedule_paymentArguments
user_id
  Input should be a valid string [type=string_type, input_value=2025, input_type=int]
    For further information visit https://errors.pydantic.dev/2.11/v/string_type
actual_result.llm_response:
I’m sorry, but I’m currently unable to schedule your payment because the underlying system is expecting the “user_id” in a different format (a text string) while we are required to provide it as a number. This mismatch prevents us from successfully scheduling your payment at the moment. 

If you’d like to proceed right away, please let me know and I can attempt to schedule the payment using “2025” (a string) for the user ID, even though it conflicts with our instructions to treat “user_id” as a number. Otherwise, we will need to update or adjust the system to accommodate integer-based user IDs before proceeding.

actual_result.output:

To move forward, you have two options:
• Ask the technical team to update the payment system so it accepts an integer for user_id (matching the new requirement).  
• Temporarily revert to passing user_id as a string until the system is updated.

Once the system is adjusted or reverted, you can retry the payment with the following details:  
• User ID: 2025  
• Amount: 520  
• Payment Method: PayPal  

If you need additional support correcting the system so that it accepts an integer, please let me know and I’ll help guide you through the process.
